intro: Vrydagzynea cheesemanii, commonly known as the Cape York hakea, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of northern Queensland, Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and dense, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to the tropical and subtropical climates of its native habitat. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
